block.p: Dr. Wendy Lynn Wall and Dr. Andrew Whitmore Robertson, history professors, were married yesterday in Malibu, Calif. The Rev. Dr. Gary Hall, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents.

Dr. Wall, who is keeping her name, is an assistant professor at Colgate University in Hamilton, N.Y. She graduated from Harvard and received a master's degree and a Ph.D. in United States history from Stanford. She is a daughter of Joyce and John Wall. The bride's father, who is retired, was an aerospace engineer at McDonnell Douglas in Huntington Beach, Calif.

Dr. Wendy Lynn Wall and Dr. Andrew Whitmore Robertson, history professors, were married yesterday in Malibu, Calif. The Rev. Dr. Gary Hall, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents.

Dr. Wall, who is keeping her name, is an assistant professor at Colgate University in Hamilton, N.Y. She graduated from Harvard and received a master's degree and a Ph.D. in United States history from Stanford. She is a daughter of Joyce and John Wall. The bride's father, who is retired, was an aerospace engineer at McDonnell Douglas in Huntington Beach, Calif.

Dr. Robertson is an assistant professor at Lehman College in the Bronx. He graduated from Franklin and Marshall College, and received a doctorate in modern history from Oxford University. He is the son of Eugene C. Robertson of Washington and the late Olivia C. Robertson. The bridegroom's father, a theoretical geophysicist, is a scientist emeritus at the United States Geological Survey in Reston, Va. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
The couple met while teaching history at California Institute of Technology in Pasadena.
